column4: my processor speed should be 2 ghz, but it is only showing as 1 ghz. i did a command to get it to 2 ghz. after i reboot, it is back 1 ghz again. why does that happen?
CPU scaling.  If there's no need to run full-steam it will throttle back.
then my applications dont open as quick?
It will htrottle back up when load gets high.
if i open 65 firefoxes (i have done it before) then will it go back to its max speed on its own?
how many firefoxes is a heavy load for AMD Athlon(tm) 64 X2 Dual Core Processor 3800+
Just run this from a terminal: `while true; do echo; done` and monitor your CPU speed; it should go up.  Ctrl-C to kill the command.
it is already up to 2 ghz now
how long will it take to go back down to 1ghz?
It depends on what speed governor you have activated.
if i use the gnome applet "CPU Frequencey Scaling Monitor", I can keep it at 2 ghz all the time
I'd let it throttle back at idle.
